title: Environmental recognition for Let's Sea
text:
Home » travel » Environmental recognition for Let's Sea AROUND THAILAND Environmental recognition for Let's Sea THE NATION July 29, 2015 1:00 am 
Environmental recognition for Let's Sea Let's Sea Hua Hin Al Fresco Resort is a pioneering destination that continues to set high standards of hospitality and design in the Hua Hin area and beyond. Environmental recognition for Let's Sea Let's Sea Hua Hin Al Fresco Resort (www.LetUsSea.com) was recently accredited with ISO14001 in recognition of its achievements in environment management. The certificate underlines the beachside resort's commitment to keeping and improving environment performance as much as its compliance with law and regulations. Delectable dining Trisara Phuket (www.Trisara.com) invites gourmets in the south to enjoy its Revamped Sunday Brunch. In addition to featuring a seafood station, imported lobster, giant prawns, crabs and four kinds of oysters, Trisara's new brunch offers a wide range of barbecue items, including mini-pulled pork burger. Guests can take in the sea view and chill to Trisara's smooth jazz quartet while savouring the exceptional dishes prepared live by the culinary team as mixologists whip up perfectly balanced Bloody Mary's. The brunch starts at 11.30am and runs until 4pm. Call (076) 310 100 extension 5 or e-mail: reservations@trisara.com. Bangkok in a Bugaboo City strolling just got easier for travelling parents as Sofitel So has partnered with Dutch mobility brand, Bugaboo, to launch a new, stylish stroller service in Southeast Asia. From this month, Sofitel So Singapore and Sofitel So Bangkok will provide guests with complimentary access to Bugaboo strollers. Parents can now avoid the hassle of transporting strollers from home, and instead enjoy the freedom to explore two of Southeast Asia's most diverse cities. The Bugaboo Stroller Service is the latest addition to the child-friendly options at the properties including baby cots, bathtubs, potties, bottle steriliser and warmer as well as a Kids Club and nanny service. Partnership to boost tourism Etihad Airways and Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) are now strategic partners, following the signing of an agreement between the national airline of the United Arab Emirates and Thailand's travel organisation to boost tourism in Thailand. Under the new agreement, the Abu Dhabi-based airline and TAT will jointly promote travel to Thailand from priority markets including the United Arab Emirates, UK, Ireland, Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, South Africa, Iran and Kuwait. The agreement was signed at Etihad Airways-Alitalia Pavilion at Expo Milan 2015. Etihad operates four flights daily between Abu Dhabi to Bangkok, and one flight daily between Abu Dhabi and Phuket in Thailand's South. 343 Viewed
